title: Rice Basics
description: Master the fundamentals of rice cultivation from seed to harvest

lessons.title: Types of Rice
lessons.content:
Major Rice Varieties

Rice (Oryza sativa) is primarily classified into three groups:

  • Indica: Long grain rice, commonly grown in tropical regions. Examples include Basmati and IR64.
  • Japonica: Short grain rice, adapted to temperate regions. Popular varieties include Calrose and Koshihikari.
  • Aromatic: Specialty varieties known for distinct fragrance, like Jasmine rice.

Key Characteristics

Each variety has specific:

  • Grain length and shape
  • Amylose content (affecting stickiness)
  • Growing season length
  • Temperature requirements
  • Disease resistance profiles

lessons.title: Growing Conditions
lessons.content:
Optimal Growing Conditions

Successful rice cultivation requires careful management of:

Temperature

  • Germination: 20-35°C
  • Vegetative Growth: 25-31°C
  • Reproductive Phase: 25-30°C

Soil Requirements

  • pH: 5.5-6.5
  • Texture: Clay loam or silty clay
  • Organic matter: > 2%

Water Management

Different growth stages require specific water depths:

  • Seedling: 2-5 cm
  • Vegetative: 5-10 cm
  • Reproductive: 10-15 cm

lessons.title: Planting Techniques
lessons.content:
Rice Planting Methods

Common planting techniques include:

  • Direct Seeding: Seeds are directly sown in the field
  • Transplanting: Seedlings are first grown in nurseries
  • Machine Transplanting: Using mechanical transplanters
